item.title: Glottal stops and alveolar taps as a non-native English speaker
item.description: Because of the notoriously confusing nature of English pronunciation in terms of phonemes, rather than letters of the alphabet, one must be aware, for example, that the word ‘enough’ begins with the same vowel phoneme as the beginning of the word ‘inept’, and ends with the same consonant as ‘stuff’.
